comments.commentBody:
On Sunday, I want to watch a football game. I don't want to be lectured to, nor prostelized upon.
Boycott the game because of an "issue" ad? not an option. Boycott that one ad? maybe. but i have a better option. i'm going to boycott ALL ads by tivoing the game, and watch it in a time shift of one-half hour. maybe if others did the same, CBS would take a financial hit and rethink its position in the future. send CBS a message - don't support any of its advertisers if it subjects us to this misguided policy.
Tebow's mother is lying. The ad is not what it presents itself as, and as a result, should not be aired. Another evil attempt by the pro life movement. Victory at any cost, even murder or lies.
face it - there is an anti-NY bias throughout the country.  after all, NY is where all of the bankers live/work.

Yes, I personally favor a side to the abortion issue, but more importantly, I believe that every private citizen and/or company is free to choose who they work with, who they hire, who they serve, who they support, and the issues associated with those decisions.  It's called freedom to be you and live by what you believe, not by what you are coerced or forced to believe in, as long as it does not inflict harm to others.  People who don't agree with this are those who selfishly want their way no matter what rights are taken away from others.  They believe their needs are greater than the needs of those who oppose them.

Just for the record, a minor correction in the New York Times obituary of Tom Brookshier...

The Head Coach of the Philadelphia Eagles in 1953 was "Jim" not "Joe" Trimble.

After he was fired by the Eagles in 1955 Trimble spent ten years as a Head Coach in the Canadian Football League. He joined the Giants in 1967 as an assistant coach and remained with New York for many, many years as a personnel guy and scout.

Trimble is also generally credited with perfecting the "slingshot" goal post that the N.F.L. adopted in 1967 and is still widely used today at all levels of football. The "slingshot" has one curved bar supporting the crossbar as opposed to the traditional "H" goal post, which had two support bars. Trimble presented it to the league as an enhancement in player safety. Years later, of course, the N.F.L. moved the goal post to the back of the end zone.

Andy, thanks for the correction. I made the fix.
And great stuff on your earlier comment and on Trimble.
It led me to look him up. Fascinating guy -- had a little of Rex Ryan in him.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Trimble
Judging from his embarrassing recent Senior Bowl performance, it looks like his NFL prospects have been, shall we say, aborted? Poetic justice, I'd say.

Nice puzzle, but an even nicer blog. When I saw the "crossword puzzle words" Jim mentioned, I first assumed that I had known those and many like them long before I started doing crosswords. But as I think about it, I must agree that I learned them the way Jim so thoughtfully described--except for EGAD. Remember an old one-panel funny-pages entry called, I believe, "Out Our Way"? It featured a pompous, rotund old blowhard named Major Hoople, who was fond of archaic expressions such as "Egad!"

By the way, we owe John Tyler a debt of gratitude. On Harrison's death he insisted on being sworn in as the new president, refusing to lead the government while still titled vice-president or to accept the title "acting president," as many in Congress desired. That, I think, is what took up much of the month Jim referred to. By the time of Lincoln's death the precedent was well in place.
I'll have my remote handy so I can hit the mute button.  Matter of fact, I probably won't even watch the "super" bowl.  Pro football is to sport what a wildebeast is to the Kentucky Derby.
Indus- try

A friend recently had posted as a facebook status update: quote from work today: "You're just using her for her vocabulary."

So I commented: someone better be careful or they will get a vernacular disease.

An old friend, arguing to his wife that he certainly did express himself clearly and that she must not be paying attention to what he was saying, claimed, "I have a great demand of the English language!"
and    to the republic for richard stans.as a kid i thought albinos came from Albania i never could figure out what the sign Watch out for pedastrains meant

Old Timer's Disease
(Alzheimer's)

Younger adults have been flocking to the cities in increasing numbers over the last 30 years. The population of NYC is at an all-time high, creeping ever closer to 9 million. Urban real estate prices are still much higher than elsewhere, especially in exurbs like Cape Coral, FL, where the housing bubble led to wild overvaluations.

The demand for suburban living is there, but it's not as universal as this guy portrays. And even in the 'burbs, increasing numbers of people are favoring "urban" policies like better transit, walkable neighborhoods, mixed-use zoning (at least in some areas), etc.

Kotkin is a provocateur.

Proselytizing is such poor form even at innocuously grandiose events as the Super Bowl, couldn't they sell another mind-numbing beer ad?

By my count, Christians 1, Lions 0. This Tebow wins again (I find this vexing).

If you want Thomas Jones back next year I am to believe you are patriot fan pretending to be jet fan for the sole purpose of seeing us jets fail.. He's 100 years old in football years .. Last year is last year it's time to move on ppl get real or get left behing .. We can get a third back for free late in the draft .. I'm all about the wins & TJ will not help us win next season ,he's done .

If CBS is the network that began the 8-second delay on live broadcasts because of Janet Jackson's "wardrobe malfunction" being an affront to all the parents who now had to explain to their kids why there was a live nipple on the Super Bowl halftime show, I wonder how they explain this woman's decision not to abort her baby boy during a nachos break while this weekend's game is airing.  Sounds infinitely more unnatural and decidedly more-adults-only fare than a nipple, which all kids have seen already.  Why on earth would you air any ad about abortion - pro or con - while people are eating?

I was surprised with the quality of villas from Miami Habitat ... definitely a different spin on staying in Miami from the typical hotel. You can find a variety of their properties here: http://paradizo.com/partner-listings/miami-habitat_1 and I'd definitely recommend them for events/weddings/reunions, etc.

Taliban has been getting regular support from from afghan administration due to the high level of corruption embedded in nearly all departments. The west forces who have been spending billions on everyday basis need to keep a strict check on the way the weapons, money and other resources being provided ti Afghan gov.t are being used. For more information check http://www.videocrux.com...

you guys can go on about picky stuff of ammo -- the article, with its birds and its smoke, drove into my mine three words as i read it's opening paragraphs: "Lexington and Concord."

Guess who the British are? Guess which army was badly armed in THAT war?

Now guess who won ...

at the very outset,you (americans)as the an invading force,came into afghanistan on the sholders of the minority uzbeks and tajiks.no one has been held accountabale for the deaths (massacre)of over 10000 pathans around mazar i sharif. right under the noses of the american special forces.Believe me guys, we as pashtuns,never forget and never forgive.
your afghan policy is total rubbish,as an invading force you are fighting the majority,the pashtuns,who do you hand over power to when you leave????????. 95% of the pashtoons have nothing to do with al -qaeda,but your policy insists since the last10 yearsto lump the taliban with al qeada.
you will never get it right.your money is halal,the tribals enjoy and laugh on the inside while taking it,changing sides for the tribals is like changing wind direction without notice.concentrate on al qaeda,al qaeda,al qaeda

This is a great little blog topic and one I want to see more of. I like the comment (Tom, number one) about re-purposed ammunition, though I have no idea if the bad guys are doing it much.

It would seem to me that feeding bad ammunition is a temporary fix but worth a try; allies would have to supply the soldiers / police forces anyway and those forces would continue selling their ammunition for chai.

Another great read from C.J. Chivers.  It seems impossible to make any progress when you can't tell the good guys from the bads guys, especially when they change allegiance based on the last deal they cut.  The sooner the Afghans take responsibility for their country the better.  Get our soldiers out of there ASAP!

People forget that we ourselves gave the Afghanis small arms and ammo from around the world when they were fighting the Soviets. In advanced weaponry, we can thank Jimmy Carter we didn't teach them how to make Stinger Missiles or we would be out of there long ago because mano a mano we can't match their fighting skills or their belief they are in the right. And the Afghanis who fight on "our side", whose fighting skills at one time matched the Taliban, have had those skills neutered by literally years now of Special Forces training. From the start we should should have just given the remaining members of the NA the best weapons to fight with and sent them out. Instead we felt we had the time and the right to reinvent them. Sheer arrogance. Now it would take a draft and millions of soldiers to win there.
